TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TrustManagerFactory extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: This class acts as a factory for trust managers based on a source of trust material.

remarks.para: This class acts as a factory for trust managers based on a source of trust material. Each trust manager manages a specific type of trust material for use by secure sockets. The trust material is based on a KeyStore and/or provider specific sources.

Android provides the following TrustManagerFactory algorithms:
Algorithm Supported API Levels
PKIX 1+
Added in 1.4.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

This is the same name that was specified in one of the getInstance calls that created this TrustManagerFactory object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property DefaultAlgorithm As String
public: static property System::String ^ DefaultAlgorithm { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Obtains the default TrustManagerFactory algorithm name.
Docs.value: the default algorithm name as specified by the ssl.TrustManagerFactory.algorithm security property, or an implementation-specific default if no such property exists.

remarks.para: Obtains the default TrustManagerFactory algorithm name.
The default TrustManager can be changed at runtime by setting the value of the ssl.TrustManagerFactory.algorithm security property to the desired algorithm name.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared Function GetInstance (algorithm As String) As TrustManagerFactory
.method public static hidebysig class Javax.Net.Ssl.TrustManagerFactory GetInstance(string algorithm) cil managed

Docs.param: the standard name of the requested trust management algorithm. See the Java Secure Socket Extension Reference Guide for information about standard algorithm names.
Docs.summary: Returns a TrustManagerFactory object that acts as a factory for trust managers.

remarks.para: Returns a TrustManagerFactory object that acts as a factory for trust managers.

This method traverses the list of registered security Providers, starting with the most preferred Provider. A new TrustManagerFactory object encapsulating the TrustManagerFactorySpi implementation from the first Provider that supports the specified algorithm is returned.
Note that the list of registered providers may be retrieved via the Security#getProviders() Security.getProviders() method.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if no installed provider can provide the requested algorithm.
if algorithm is null (instead of NoSuchAlgorithmException as in 1.4 release)

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared Function GetInstance (algorithm As String, provider As Provider) As TrustManagerFactory

public static Javax.Net.Ssl.TrustManagerFactory? GetInstance (string? algorithm, Java.Security.Provider? provider);
.method public static hidebysig class Javax.Net.Ssl.TrustManagerFactory GetInstance(string algorithm, class Java.Security.Provider provider) cil managed
static member GetInstance : string * Java.Security.Provider -> Javax.Net.Ssl.TrustManagerFactory

Docs.param: the standard name of the requested trust management algorithm. See the Java Secure Socket Extension Reference Guide for information about standard algorithm names.
Docs.summary: Returns a TrustManagerFactory object that acts as a factory for trust managers.

remarks.para: Returns a TrustManagerFactory object that acts as a factory for trust managers.

A new TrustManagerFactory object encapsulating the TrustManagerFactorySpi implementation from the specified Provider object is returned. Note that the specified Provider object does not have to be registered in the provider list.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the specified provider cannot provide the requested algorithm.
if algorithm is null (instead of NoSuchAlgorithmException as in 1.4 release)

.method public static hidebysig class Javax.Net.Ssl.TrustManagerFactory GetInstance(string algorithm, string provider) cil managed
static member GetInstance : string * string -> Javax.Net.Ssl.TrustManagerFactory

Docs.param: the standard name of the requested trust management algorithm. See the Java Secure Socket Extension Reference Guide for information about standard algorithm names.
Docs.summary: Returns a TrustManagerFactory object that acts as a factory for trust managers.

remarks.para: Returns a TrustManagerFactory object that acts as a factory for trust managers.
A new KeyManagerFactory object encapsulating the KeyManagerFactorySpi implementation from the specified provider is returned. The specified provider must be registered in the security provider list.
Note that the list of registered providers may be retrieved via the Security#getProviders() Security.getProviders() method.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the specified provider cannot provide the requested algorithm.
if the specified provider does not exist.
if algorithm is null (instead of NoSuchAlgorithmException as in 1.4 release)

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Init(class Java.Security.KeyStore ks) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes this factory with a source of certificate authorities and related trust material.

remarks.para: Initializes this factory with a source of certificate authorities and related trust material.
The provider typically uses a KeyStore as a basis for making trust decisions.
For more flexible initialization, please see #init(ManagerFactoryParameters).
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Init(class Javax.Net.Ssl.IManagerFactoryParameters spec) cil managed

Docs.param: an implementation of a provider-specific parameter specification
Docs.summary: Initializes this factory with a source of provider-specific trust material.

remarks.para: Initializes this factory with a source of provider-specific trust material.

In some cases, initialization parameters other than a keystore may be needed by a provider. Users of that particular provider are expected to pass an implementation of the appropriate ManagerFactoryParameters as defined by the provider. The provider can then call the specified methods in the ManagerFactoryParameters implementation to obtain the needed information.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
